meanings.definition: A detailed written study or specialized book on a single subject.
meanings.sent1: The professor published a monograph on ancient civilizations.
meanings.sent2: I borrowed a monograph from the library to learn about marine biology.
meanings.sent3: The monograph about insects was so interesting, it made me want to become an entomologist.
meanings.sent4: Her monograph on space exploration was a journey through the stars on paper.
meanings.sent5: The monograph on dinosaurs brought those ancient creatures back to life in my imagination.

meanings.definition: To write a detailed study or specialized book on a single subject.
meanings.sent1: She decided to monograph her research findings on climate change.
meanings.sent2: Authors often monograph their expertise to share knowledge with others.
meanings.sent3: I will monograph my love for cooking by writing a cookbook.
meanings.sent4: He monographs his thoughts and experiences in a personal journal.
meanings.sent5: The artist monographs the beauty of nature through intricate drawings.
